data.title: AAA radio (Adult Album Alternative)
data.meta_description: listening to 2 of my favourite on line stations.
data.text:
There's an industry web site http://www.triplearadio.com which has news of US stations and lists of suggested songs for play listing.

They include stations like KCRW and WFPK in the category, both favourites of mine. KCRW tends to be focused more on newer music and artists who are connected to the LA music scene, with some good late night (i.e. breakfast time here) specialist shows. WFPK is good for rock, blues, vintage roots music and jazz - a format that doesn't exist here.

For me the most important aspect of the format is that those stations don't assume the audience just wants to hear singles. They choose the songs that sound good on their own merit, not because they're being "released" as a single.

The thing with AAA is that it's different things to different people. The US AAAs have varying sounds, from MVY to Chicago's WXRT, to Los Angeles' classic rock-leaning The Sound, to the public stations like KEXP, KCMP and WFUV.

Arguably 6 Music is AAA (leaning more towards alternative) and the Original stations, too. Closest we probably had to this format is The Coast, which would later become Jack South Coast.

An interesting thread. I think there is a gap in Britain. If I worked hard enough on it, I could probably produce a reasonably coherent link between (a) Muscle Shoals, West Coast, Classic Singer/Songwriter and (b) Acoustic Mainstream Indie 80s/90s/00s. I'd also want to throw in a fair bit of rock and roll, country, cool jazz, African,

Latin, 60s Euro curiosity, psychedelia, blues and the 2000s folk roots revival. Soulful, melodic, quirky, breezy.

Few hard edges but gutsy. Lots of movement but calming. Unpredictable yet complimentary and reassuring.

that sounds like an interesting mix ,it sounds like you would love to set up your own station!

It would be good to have a UK based AAA station (of the type that avoids hard rock and rap music) even if was internet only, they would be more aware of the UK and Irish music scene and provide tour dates etc. ( like 6 music does).

Apart from the excellent music played (and with large playlists) the presenters on the stations such as WUMB and MVY radio are people who like what they play and pass on information about the artists.

--- Ugh I hope not!!!

Well although not totally an AAA station because of our high sports/speech content, Eklipse Sports Radio's actual music format is as damn close to AAA as we can get, Possibly a little towards the classic AOR - Mike and Mechanics, Allman Brothers etc, but since we ditched heavy rock such as Korn it seems to be settling down quite nicely.

Available now on all good DAB sets across Central Scotland and online!

http://www.eklipsesportsradio.co.uk/listen.php

when on holiday in west Wales I came across an excellent show on RTE radio 1:

John Creeden 8 to 10pm Mon to Fri http://www.rte.ie/radio1/john-creedon/

I am sure Irish posters to this forum are well aware of him.

I would class this show as AAA (adult album alternative)

heres a playlist from Monday evening:

Substitute

The Who

Whats Going On

Taste

Love Like This

Kodaline

Way Back When

Kodaline

Take The Star Out Of The Window

John Prine

Sam Stone

John Prine

Love's Been Good To Me

Johnny Cash

Sunday Morning Coming Down

Kris Kristofferson

All Along The Watchtower

Jimi Hendrix

All Gone Away

The Style Council

Cruel To Be Kind

Nick Lowe

Family Affair

Sly And The Family Stone

Low Rider

War

I Like It Like That

Pucho And His Latin Soul Brothers

Back To Black

Amy Winehouse

Our Day Will Come

Amy Winehouse

Run On For A Long Time

Blind Boys Of Alabama

I Love King Selassie

Black Uhuru

Gone Forever

Mick Flannery

Stuff That Works

Guy Clark

I Met Up With The King

First Aid Kit

And A Bang On The Ear

The Waterboys

A great mix of music and a very knowledgable presenter.

And the good thing about RTE Radio 1 is that it available across the UK on Sky and Virgin TV.

So programs can be easily recorded to listen when you like.
